Introduction
Purpose of this document
This document describes the libiers10++ Software Package and serves as a reference manual. There should be an application programming interface (API) shipped with the Package, located at iers2010/doc/html; you can open the file index.html with your favorite web browser and serach through the API. In case this folder is empty (i.e. iers2010/doc/html), you can create the API via running doxygen using the configuration filedoxy.conf. In any Unix-type system,just open a terminal/konsole and execute the following: bash$ doxygen doxy.conf If doxygen is not available in your system, you can download it from this link. Note that using doxygen and modifing the config file, you can create the documentation in various formats (e.g. ps, latex, html, docbook, etc).
Revision History
1.0 2015-01-22 XP Initial release.
Contributions
Most of the source code accompaning libiers10++ is translated from FORTRAN routines and/or subroutines provided by the International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS). Although we have tried to 'stick' as much as possible to the original implementation, there are always minor or major modιfications. The results of any function though, should coincide exactly with the ones obtained when using the original FORTRAN routines (see )
This document is based on the Linux Documentation Project templates, so we are grateful to this community.
